reference.shortdesc: A section division is a grouping of sequential content within a section. There is no additional semantic meaning attached. It is useful primarily as a specialization base and for reuse.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The sectiondiv element cannot contain a title. If a title is required, use nested topics.

The sectiondiv element can nest itself, so it can be used as a specialization base. Another common use case for the sectiondiv element is to group a sequence of related elements for reuse, so that another topic can reference the entire set with a single conref or conkeyref attribute.
The sectiondiv element can only be used within section elements. Use the div element to group content that might occur in both topic bodies and sections.

example.title: Example
example.p: In the example below, the sectiondiv element is used to group content that can be reused elsewhere.
example.codeblock:
Nice pets

Cats are nice.

Dogs are nice.

Friends of mine really love their hedgehogs.

Lots of people want ponies when they grow up.

Llamas are also popular.
